meanings.sent1: I decided to prebuy the concert tickets to make sure we get good seats.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to prebuy her favorite snacks before they run out.
meanings.sent3: I prebought the new video game, so now I just have to wait for it to be released.
meanings.sent4: He prebuys all his clothes online to avoid the hassle of shopping in stores.
meanings.sent5: The smart shopper prebuys items on sale to save money in the long run.

meanings.definition: The act of buying something before it is available for general sale.
meanings.sent1: My prebuy of the limited edition sneakers arrived just in time for the event.
meanings.sent2: The company offered a prebuy option for the new product to loyal customers.
meanings.sent3: The prebuy of the concert tickets made the fans excited for the upcoming show.
meanings.sent4: The prebuy of the latest smartphone model caused a lot of buzz in the tech community.
meanings.sent5: Her prebuy of the exclusive book allowed her to read it before anyone else.
